ACT
25
Spouse and common-law partner
The right of inheritance between spouses ends with the divorce and annulment of the marriage.
The spouse does not have the right to inherit:
1) if the testator has filed a lawsuit for divorce or annulment of marriage, or a consensual request for divorce, and after the testator's death it is established that they were founded;
2) if his marriage with the testator is declared non-existent, or is annulled after the testator's death due to causes of which the surviving spouse knew or should have known at the time of the marriage,
3) if his community of life with the testator was permanently terminated due to his fault or in agreement with the testator.
A common-law partner does not have the right to inherit if his union of life with the testator was permanently terminated.
